et: Middle English, to flood, inundate, from Anglo-French {it}surunder{/it}, from Late Latin {it}superundare{/it}, to overflow, from Latin {it}super-{/it} + {it}unda{/it} wave; influenced in meaning by {et_link|round:5|round:5} {ma}{mat|water|}{/ma}
